title: 110_s3620
content: The "Child Care Investment Act of 2008" may be cited as the short title for this Act, which provides funding for child care. The "Child Care Investment Act of 2008" amends Section 418 of the Social Security Act to allocate $3,717,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2009 to 2014 for child care funding. The amendment to Section 418 of the Social Security Act includes aligning margins, changing references from "this section" to "this subsection," and replacing "subsection (a)(1)" with "paragraph (1)." Additionally, a new subsection (b) is added for Quality Initiatives, with an appropriation of $300,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2009 to 2014. The amendment to Section 418 of the Social Security Act includes aligning margins, changing references, and adding a new subsection (b) for Quality Initiatives with a $300,000,000 appropriation annually from 2009 to 2014. Grants are made to eligible States based on a formula, with States required to submit applications to the Secretary for funding. Grant funds must be used for establishing Quality Rating and Improvement Systems for child care providers. The amendment to Section 418 of the Social Security Act includes Quality Initiatives for child care providers, with criteria for different age groups and assistance for education and training. The amendment to Section 418 of the Social Security Act includes Quality Initiatives for child care providers, such as establishing a statewide network of specialists for training and consultation, and implementing standards for health and safety training for child care providers. The amendment to Section 418 of the Social Security Act includes Quality Initiatives for child care providers, such as requirements for regular monitoring visits and reimbursement rates at or above the 75th percentile of market rates.
